nodes.text: Star Wars was a book-and-record/book-and-tape adaptation of Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope, published in 1979 as part of Buena Vista Records' Read-Along Adventures series. It was produced by Jymn Magon and was one of the few works licensed by the short-lived Lucasfilm subsidiary Black Falcon Ltd. The cassette tape version was re-released in a collection along with the other two original films' adaptations in 1984.
In 1997, Walt Disney Records released an updated version that included new material from the Special Edition of A New Hope.

The Danish edition of the audio tape, titled Stjernekrigen (literally, "the Starwar"), is notorious for its many mistranslations and mispronunciations, and its generally silly phrasing, which have given it a cult status among Danish first-generation Star Wars fans, who celebrate its kitsch and nostalgic value.
